required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Evaluate the Feasibility and Efficacy of Digital Health Technology for Postoperative Care With Gastrectomy-Treated Patients in Gastric Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this pilot study is to evaluate the feasibility and efficacy of Rhexium Onco Nutrition, HDT-202 for post-operative care in patients who have undergone gastrectomy.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. A total of 4 visits will be performed.
2. At the screening visit,subject's written informed consent, assessing the inclusion/exclusion criteria and assigning enrollment numbers to eligible subjects, demographic information taking, medical history/medication history taking, vital signs measuring, physical examination, height and body weight measuring, instructing how to install/use the investigational device, and administering quality of life questionnaires.
3. During the treatment period, a total of 3 visits will be performed. To evaluate feasibility and efficacy, the following procedures will be carried out: vital signs measuring, physical examination, nutrition assessment/consultation, evaluation of feasibility for 'subjects', evaluation of feasibility for 'investigators', and adverse events (AEs)/concomitant medications checking and collecting.
4. During the treatment period, telephone monitoring is conducted depending on the compliance of subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Score of each domain of the 'feasibility assessment of the investigational device (application)' questionnaire for subjects
primary_outcome.description: higher scores mean a better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Score of each domain of the 'feasibility assessment of the investigational device (application)' questionnaire for subjects
primary_outcome.description: higher scores mean a better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Score of each domain of the 'feasibility assessment of the investigational device (application)' questionnaire for subjects
primary_outcome.description: higher scores mean a better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Score of each domain of the 'feasibility assessment of the investigational device (website)' questionnaire for investigators
primary_outcome.description: higher scores mean a better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline (Visit 1) in 'EORTC QLQ-C30' score
Change from baseline (Visit 1) in 'EORTC QLQ-STO22' score
Change from baseline (Visit 1) in 'KOQUSS Index' score
Correlation between change from Day 1 in body weight at Week 10 (Visit 4) and calory goal achievement rate
Correlation between change from Day 1 in body weight at Week 10 (Visit 4) and protein intake goal achievement rate
Frequency of each symptom between visits after using the investigational device (application)
The investigational device(application) usage compliance by age
secondary_outcome.description: compliance(%) will be measured to day of usage/total period*100

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigational device(application) usage compliance by gender
secondary_outcome.description: compliance(%) will be measured to day of usage/total period*100

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigational device(application) usage compliance by surgery
secondary_outcome.description: compliance(%) will be measured to day of usage/total period*100

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigational device(application) usage compliance by stage of disease
secondary_outcome.description: compliance(%) will be measured to day of usage/total period*100

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigational device(application) usage compliance by body mass index [BMI] before discharge from hospital
secondary_outcome.description: weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2, compliance(%) will be measured to day of usage/total period*100

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigational device(application) usage compliance by status of postoperative anticancer therapy
secondary_outcome.description: compliance(%) will be measured to day of usage/total period*100

secondary_outcome.measure: The investigational device(application) usage compliance by underlying disease
secondary_outcome.description: compliance(%) will be measured to day of usage/total period*100

other_outcome.measure: Frequency of each symptom by baseline characteristics (age, gender, surgery, stage of disease, BMI before discharge from hospital, status of postoperative anticancer therapy, underlying disease)

other_outcome.description: Incident rate of Adverse Events will be reported

arm_group.description: "subject mobile application" and "Investigator web portal" with no invasive action on the human body

intervention.description: The research devices in this study are classified into "subject mobile application" and "investigator web portal" with no invasive action on the human body

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient who voluntarily signs the informed consent form for this study
2. Age of ≥19 years old
3. Patient who has undergone therapeutic gastrectomy after a diagnosis of gastric cancer
4. Able to eat food orally after gastrectomy
5. Patient who possesses an Android OS based mobile device and is capable of using the investigational device.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Other cancer or metastasis documented within 5 years prior to screening
2. Ongoing or planned enteral tube feeding or total parenteral nutrition
3. Other clinically significant medical or psychiatric findings based on which the individual is considered by the investigator to be ineligible
4. Individual who possesses a mobile device on which the application is unable to be installed and/or run normally for technical reasons
5. Individual who, in the opinion of the investigator, has difficulty understanding how to use the investigational device or is unlikely to comply with other study procedures

facility.name: Department of Surgery, Seoul National University Hospital
